title: First Starliner crewed flight further delayed
summary: NASA has delayed the first flight of Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner commercial crew vehicle with astronauts on board, a slip that will push back the spacecraft’s first operational mission into 2024.

title: NASA to Discuss Psyche Independent Review Board Results
summary: NASA will host a community townhall at 12 p.m. EDT on Friday, Nov. 4, followed by a media teleconference at 1 p.m. to discuss the findings and recommendations of a report by the Psyche mission independent review board.

title: SLS to return to LC-39B for next Artemis I launch opportunity
summary: The first Space Launch System (SLS) rocket is planned to make the 6.7 km trip from High Bay 3 in the Vehicle Assembly Building (VAB) back out to Launch Complex 39B on Friday morning. The move follows a five-week stay in the VAB to shelter from Hurricane Ian and allow teams to prepare the vehicle for its next launch attempt.

title: NASA to Provide Coverage of Preview Briefing, US Spacewalks
summary: Astronauts aboard the International Space Station will conduct a series of U.S. spacewalks in November and December to install mounting hardware and a pair of rollout solar arrays to increase electrical power to support station operations and scientific research.

title: FCC proposes new bureau for space activities
summary: The chairwoman of the Federal Communications Commission announced plans Nov. 3 to reorganize the agency and create a bureau devoted to the its increasing work with space systems.

title: Rocket from Chinese space station module launch predicted to make uncontrolled reentry Nov. 4
summary: The large first stage of the Long March 5B rocket which sent the Mengtian space station module into orbit earlier this week is set for an uncontrolled reentry Friday, Nov. 4.

title: SpaceX launches Hotbird 3G to extend Eutelsat’s broadcast coverage
summary: SpaceX launched the second of two satellites for Eutelsat Nov. 3 to replenish one of the largest broadcast systems in Europe, the Middle East and Northern Africa.

title: Falling Chinese rocket expected to enter Earth’s atmosphere in <2 days
summary: "We hope they will take the reaction to this one into account."

title: Exotrail signs launch agreement with Isar Aerospace
summary: Exotrail, a French company developing orbital transfer vehicles, has signed a contract with German launch vehicle developer Isar Aerospace for multiple launches over the next several years.

title: SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket completes 50th orbital launch of 2022
summary: SpaceX has successfully launched French satellite communications provider Eutelsat’s Hotbird 13G satellite, chipping away at a jam-packed November manifest and completing Falcon...
